Pre-Game Insights: Benin were outclassed and outplayed by Nigeria in their Group D opener, resulting in a 3-0 defeat.
Libya was held to a 1-1 draw by Rwanda, ending their nine-game unbeaten run across all competitions.
Libya's last appearance in the Africa Cup of Nations was in 2012.
Benin have claimed seven points from their four matches in the World Cup qualifying campaign, sitting third in Group C.
Libya sits second in Group D, level on seven points with Cape Verde and one point behind leaders Cameroon.
Despite their recent poor performance, Benin are expected to field an unchanged XI, with David Kiki, Olivier Verdon, Cedric Hountondji, and Rachid Moumini forming the back four.
